item.title: Hahahaha
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Greeny:

If they can sue players for breaking ToS/T&C it seems to me MITB can sue Jagex for breaking his ToS. (Which seems ridiculous to me as I always thought it meant nothing in a court of law).

And that’s what I’ve always said about my TOS as well. I don’t know if it is legally binding in court, I doubt it would be, but it is certainly just as legally binding as Jagex’s TOS.

Read full topic

item.title: Hahahaha
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:20, topic:421099”]They pull so much so much shit out of their asses it is untrue. They can accuse us of lying and from a PR stand point because the players support them obviously they’ll get believed over us.

Now I know we’re not lawyers, but I still cannot believe you can be sued for breaking the T&C. If someone knows anyone studying/practicing law they should ask them ideally.

They can sue whoever the hell they want, winning is a different story.

I think this is a pretty accurate statement.

From what I understand if T&C are broken then they reserve the right to shutdown the service they provide to you - in this case your runescape account. They’d need some seriously good lawyers to argue that you caused damages, as the defendant’s lawyers can surely just argue so why didn’t they ban them permanently and prevent further damages etc.

IANAL so I may be chatting shit. Either way Jagex are taking some pretty controversial actions, and they’ve never made retorts directly to bot developers/communties in public announcements like this before. Thus making me very sceptical as to whether they’re simply making threats (If they knew they could win in court surely they’d just keep it in court and avoid all the public facing palava).

If they can sue players for breaking ToS/T&C it seems to me MITB can sue Jagex for breaking his ToS. (Which seems ridiculous to me as I always thought it meant nothing in a court of law).[/quote]
At last part: do it!

Read full topic

item.title: Hahahaha
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

My point of view is that the ToS are designed to prevent people from “damaging” the gaming experience. If people violate the ToS, they are damaging the gaming experience for other players, and ruining the integrity of Jagex’s product. I think this is the only angle they can come from. More importantly, though, they would be able to show that some players, regardless of being banned from breaking the ToS, continue to consciously violate their terms and continue to ruin Jagex’s product.

But even saying “ruin Jagex’s product” is a stretch, like Greeny said. They would need very good lawyers to prove this point. They have no angle where they can correlate ToS violators and loss of profits, unless they somehow consider all the extra bot task forces to be a “loss of profits.” I don’t know.

I don’t think suing players is going anywhere, other than being a good scare tactic to impress upon the RuneScape community. I mean this is surely terrible for business in the short-term, so it’s definitely an extreme for them to take right now. “Have you ever played RuneScape?” “What? No. I hear the company that makes it sues their players, haha.” etc

Read full topic

item.title: Hahahaha
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t see any punishments in the ToS, other than being banned from the game. And I don’t know about a law that states you get x years in prison when you break ToS you agreed to. So breaking the ToS itself is not illegal.

Read full topic

item.title: Hahahaha
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Greeny:

Now I know we’re not lawyers, but I still cannot believe you can be sued for breaking the T&C.

Terms and conditions are just that, terms and conditions. Jagex’s T&C are not the law, breaking their T&C is not breaking the law. They can get you for trying to cause them monetary loss or whatever it is their suing for now, although it all seems sort of silly, trying to sue players…

Edit: o you added to your post, so yeah what you said.

Read full topic

item.title: Hahahaha
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

They pull so much so much shit out of their asses it is untrue. They can accuse us of lying and from a PR stand point because the players support them obviously they’ll get believed over us.

Now I know we’re not lawyers, but I still cannot believe you can be sued for breaking the T&C. If someone knows anyone studying/practicing law they should ask them ideally.

Davidi2:

They can sue whoever the hell they want, winning is a different story.

I think this is a pretty accurate statement.

From what I understand if T&C are broken then they reserve the right to shutdown the service they provide to you - in this case your runescape account. They’d need some seriously good lawyers to argue that you caused damages, as the defendant’s lawyers can surely just argue so why didn’t they ban them permanently and prevent further damages etc.

IANAL so I may be chatting shit. Either way Jagex are taking some pretty controversial actions, and they’ve never made retorts directly to bot developers/communties in public announcements like this before. Thus making me very sceptical as to whether they’re simply making threats (If they knew they could win in court surely they’d just keep it in court and avoid all the public facing palava).

If they can sue players for breaking ToS/T&C it seems to me MITB can sue Jagex for breaking his ToS. (Which seems ridiculous to me as I always thought it meant nothing in a court of law).

Read full topic

Might as well sign your posts with a nice message for a Jagex mod or something.

Hey Jagex! I know more about your game then most of you do. I’d like to be a player moderator. I follow all the rules and know when to mute people! Shoot me a PM for details.

:rolleyes:

item.description:
@TehDew wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:4, topic:421099”]<bootnecklad__> Some of you may also have noticed recently that a significant former bot developer RSBuddy has both acknowledged the harm caused to RuneScape by bots but also completely renounced the further development of any bot software, taking the decision to reform into a RS fansite instead. I warmly welcome this well considered and smart development, I hope that all other bot developers will quickly see the wisdom in RS Buddy’s actions and lik
<bootnecklad__> ewise summarily shut down their own harmful operations before it’s too late. In recognition of recent events and as gesture of goodwill Jagex will draw a line under RSBuddy’s previous activity and that of their former customers provided they remain true to their pledge.
<bootnecklad__> ORLY
sounds like Jacmob got threatened
shut down to protect his userbase
???

I Work For Jagex Lol
<frank_> as stork would say, huehuehuehuehue
Look At Me I Am Going To Be 17 And Working On The Official Runescape Game Engine

pretty much it.[/quote]
